results.title: Dylan Thomas
results.brief_description: Born in Swansea, Wales, in 1914, Dylan Thomas would eventually become one of the greatest English-language poets of his century. This lyrical documentary uses archival material and reconstructed dramatic sequences to situate his poetry in his earliest experiences of growing up as a child in Wales. By concentrating on his childhood, and his early career as a journalist and poet, this biography links the themes of his poetry and prose in the sensual inspiration that the Welsh landscape provided the young artist. The voice of Dylan is heard reading several of his poems.

results.title: Dying to be thin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
An examination of the slimmer’s desease, anorexia nervosa. Through interviews with those who have, or have had the disorder, examines the psychological and societal pressures which induce young women to diet to the point of starvation.

results.title: Duty free
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer, ONF | NFB and F Whitman Trecartin
results.brief_description: A colorful, rollicking account of Nova Scotia’s rum-running days, told in part by mariners who made the runs into forbidden American ports some fifty years ago, and in part by re-enactments of their tales by actors. The sources of their profitable illegal cargoes were the French islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon, quiet enough now, but once busy rendezvous for smugglers.

results.title: Dutch Pirates Are Heroes
results.creator_credit: Joy Barrow, David E. Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Every April, in the Dutch city of Brielle, the community holds a festival of dance, wine and song to commemorate the 1572 victory of Flemish pirates and beggars over the invading Spanish ships. The festival involves a procession through the main square and a re-creation of the battle between the pirates and the Spanish sailors.

results.title: Dutch oven cooking
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic principles of fire building and Dutch oven cooking for hikers and campers. Emphasizes the care and precision which must be exercised when sharpening and using axes and knives; demonstrates the correct methods for chopping wood. Describes, step by step, the procedure for making a batch of biscuits including the preparation of the Dutch oven for baking.

results.title: Dusty hearts
results.creator_credit: Mariel Beros, AFTRS and Pauline Chan
results.brief_description: Sax Elthan is a hapless musician, a refugee from the inner city. Rejected by his girlfriend, he travels to the outback to look for work. One burning Wednesday he finds himself beside a highway, waiting for a lift, contemplating his future. It arrives in the shape of a beat-up Volkswagon with a wardrobe tied to the roof. A black comedy about one man’s destiny starring Geoff Morrell (Blue Heelers, Changi). Also features Tina Bursill.

results.title: Dusty (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Dusty is a film that will captivate with its values of love, loyalty and the quest for freedom. Based on the classic Australian book by Frank Dalby Davison, this is the story of an ill-fated bond between an old man and his dog. Tom Lincoln, an ageing drover, buys Dusty in a hotel, unaware that the dog is part kelpie and part dingo. He trains Dusty into a champion sheep dog but becomes aware his dog has the killer in his blood. Finally he returns to the bush, set apart from the world by his love for his dog. Rated: G
